input: Request: Create a sonnet about the beauty of a sunset, using Shakespearean style.
output:
Upon the azure vaults where the sun doth hang,  
Thou regnant queen, o'ershadowing with glowing light,  
The evening cloak thy hues dost slowly change;  
From fire to gold in transient hour dost fly.

How fair thou art, when all of earth's delights  
Are hid beneath the shadowing night-firmament! 
Upon thy breast the moon dost softly press,
And stars themselves doth borrow thine own light.
Yet ere thy radiance thus doth wholly fade,  
I must from these celestial eyes partake;
O let me see thee fall in quietude,
Thou fairest one art thou who dost Earth's face take  
To make its darkest hour but lovely grace.
